content.raw: It's my understanding that the sleep time in `World::Step(unsigned int)` is not used for controlling the rate of physics updates. Physics updates happen in a separate thread. Some user code (usually a gtest instance) can call `Step(unsigned int)` from its thread, which increases `World::stepInc` and then polls the condition `this->stepInc == 0 || this->stop` inside a while loop. The actual physics update happen in another thread that decrements `this->stepInc` as steps are taken. The other thread also controls the real time update rate (see [World::Step()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/571432555923ed898da6726c9a419c82b2c2deeb/gazebo/physics/World.cc#cl-553) with no arguments).
